data.name: replays_description_part_1
data.value: Replays are recorded in the .echoreplay file format, which contains all API data from the game. Echoreplay files to not contain any video or audio data.

data.name: Speaker System
data.comment: tab in main window

data.name: Text-to-Speech
data.comment: tab in Settings

data.name: TTS only works when logged in with Discord!
data.value:
TTS only works when logged in with Discord!
(top left of main window)

data.name: tts_description
data.value:
TTS allows you to hear events while in game. Make sure to set up your speakers appropriately to be able to hear the output.
On Rift, set your default Windows sound output to the Rift headphones.
On Quest, use headphones attached to your PC or turn up the speakers.
data.comment:
テキスト読み上げを使用すると、ゲーム中に聞くことができます。その際、出力が聞こえるようにスピーカーを適切に設置してください。
Riftでは、Windowsのデフォルトのサウンド出力をRiftのヘッドフォンに設定します。
クエストでは、PCに接続したヘッドホンを使うか、スピーカーの音量をあげて下さい。

data.name: Upload to Firestore
data.comment: not in the public version, so not really necessary

data.name: upload_description
data.value: Uploads data to the Personal Ignite database. This is separate from the public match stats, but is still visible on the website. Discord Login is required for stat uploading. Only public matches are uploaded.

data.name: Very Fast
data.comment: refers to putting the replay files in a .zip file

data.name: instance_already_running_message
data.value: Instance already running. Running two instances of Spark at the same time can cause problems. Check the task tray in the bottom right, or the Task Manager to kill the old instance if something broke.

data.name: Maximum speed achieved for times when you are faster than 20 m/s

data.name: nvhighlights_description_1
data.value: To enable NVIDIA Highlights, first enable the NVIDIA overlay in Geforce Experience, then enable the Highlights feature from within the overlay (ALT+Z). The events that you want to trigger a clip can be customized in the NVIDIA overlay while the game is open.

data.name: nvhighlights_description_2
data.value: Make sure to enable Desktop recording (under the 'Privacy control' section in the overlay), otherwise only this program will be recorded.

data.name: optInCheckbox.ToolTip
data.value: Shows more detailed stats on metrics.ignitevr.gg, including estimated height, play times, and hand dominance.

data.name: EchoVROpen settings warning
data.value: EchoVR is open. EchoVR saves its settings when it closes, so any settings you set here will be overwritten when EchoVR closes. Make sure to close EchoVR before changing anything here.

data.name: EchoVR Settings info
data.value: These settings control game settings found in 'C:\Users\[USERNAME]\AppData\Local\rad\loneecho\settings_mp_v2.json'. This is useful for spectator computers without a headset attached.

data.name: Display
data.comment: refers to Display settings for the game

data.name: Graphics
data.comment: refers to Graphics settings for the game

data.name: EchoVR not installed game settings
data.value: EchoVR is not found on this PC. Make sure you have EchoVR installed if you want to be able to change these settings, or set the path to the EchoVR executable manually in the General tab.

data.name: enableAutoFocusCheckbox.ToolTip
data.value: Makes sure EchoVR is the topmost window every few seconds.

data.name: betaUpdates.ToolTip
data.value: Gets updates to the beta channel of Spark if they are available. (restart Spark to check for updates)

data.name: OBS integration requires the OBS Websocket plugin.
data.value: OBS integration requires the OBS Websocket plugin. The replay buffer must be set up in OBS settings before this feature can work.

data.name: Automatic Scene Switching
data.comment: OBS scene switching

data.name: Customize your hotkey in Medal by going to Settings (bottom left) -> Hotkeys. The default is F8, but this also hides player nametags and the HUD in Echo, so you may want to change the default. F12 should be good for most people.
data.value: Customize your hotkey in Medal by going to Settings (bottom left) -> Hotkeys. The default is F8, but this also hides player nametags and the HUD in Echo, so you may want to change the default. F12 should be good for most people.

data.name: You can use Medal to record your entire session, and have Spark make bookmarks instead of saving clips. Enable this feature in Medal's Settings->Recorder->Special Features->Full Session Recording. Set 'Seconds After' to 0s to have the correct event timing in this case.
data.value: You can use Medal to record your entire session, and have Spark make bookmarks instead of saving clips. Enable this feature in Medal's Settings->Recorder->Special Features->Full Session Recording. Set 'Seconds After' to 0s to have the correct event timing in this case.

data.name: Change clip length in the medal settings window. (Settings->Recorder)
data.value: Change clip length in the medal settings window. (Settings->Recorder)

data.name: Voice recognition is powered by Vosk. All audio data is processed locally on your device and not uploaded to a server.
data.value: Voice recognition is powered by Vosk. All audio data is processed locally on your device and not uploaded to a server.

data.name: Say 'Clip That' at any point to save a clip
data.value: Say 'Clip That' at any point to save a clip
